comments:
I'm running Eclipse on Sun JDK1.3.1_02 and am debugging a Swing application 
using the Sun JDK1.4.0 runtime VM. When I switch focus away from my Swing app 
to the Eclipse workbench, I see this error. 

org.eclipse.swt.SWTError: No more handles
	at org.eclipse.swt.SWT.error(SWT.java:1912)
	at org.eclipse.swt.SWT.error(SWT.java:1819)
	at org.eclipse.swt.graphics.Image.init(Image.java:1497)
	at org.eclipse.swt.graphics.Image.<init>(Image.java:151)
	at org.eclipse.swt.custom.StyledText.performPaint(StyledText.java:4646)
	at org.eclipse.swt.custom.StyledText.handlePaint(StyledText.java:4608)
	at org.eclipse.swt.custom.StyledText$13.handleEvent
(StyledText.java:4327)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.EventTable.sendEvent(EventTable.java:75)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Widget.sendEvent(Widget.java:841)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Composite.WM_PAINT(Composite.java:658)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Control.windowProc(Control.java:2687)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Display.windowProc(Display.java:1807)
	at org.eclipse.swt.internal.win32.OS.DispatchMessageW(Native Method)
	at org.eclipse.swt.internal.win32.OS.DispatchMessage(OS.java:1208)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Display.readAndDispatch(Display.java:1206)
	at org.eclipse.jface.window.Window.runEventLoop(Window.java:538)
	at org.eclipse.jface.window.Window.open(Window.java:525)
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.dialogs.InternalErrorDialog.openQuestion
(InternalErrorDialog.java:171)
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.ExceptionHandler.openQuestionDialog
(ExceptionHandler.java:142)
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.ExceptionHandler.handleException
(ExceptionHandler.java:60)
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.Workbench.runEventLoop(Workbench.java:758)
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.Workbench.run(Workbench.java:738)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.boot.InternalBootLoader.run
(InternalBootLoader.java:777)
	at org.eclipse.core.boot.BootLoader.run(BootLoader.java:319)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Native Method)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.basicRun(Main.java:196)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.run(Main.java:555)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.main(Main.java:396)

"No more handles" means that some needed operating system UI resource has been 
completed depleted. I'm not sure why this would be happening in this case 
though, unless your Swing application is doing something exceptional. I've 
run/debugged Swing apps before without problem, although at the time I was 
using 1.3.1.

Does this happen with simple examples, or is it a side-effect of your 
particular Swing app?
This problem is no longer reproducable in current builds.
